plan:
We will build a minimal yet solid baseline that treats each symbolic character
as a token, embeds it, runs a single-layer Bi-LSTM, and predicts the
acceptability label with a linear head.  A small vocabulary is induced from the
training split, padding is handled in the collate-fn, and packed sequences let
the model ignore padded positions.  We train for only a few epochs with Adam,
log validation loss and Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) every epoch, and
finally report MCC on the hidden test set.  All metrics/losses/predictions are
stored in a structured experiment_data dict and dumped to the ./working folder.
The code respects the mandatory GPU/CPU handling rules, keeps execution outside
any if-main guard, and runs end-to-end in a single file.

We start with a compact character-level baseline: every input sequence is
tokenised into individual symbols, mapped to integer IDs, padded/truncated to a
fixed length and fed into a lightweight neural network (Embedding → Bi-LSTM →
mean-pool → Linear).  The dataset is loaded from the local SPR_BENCH folder via
the provided helper; if the folder is absent we fall back to a small synthetic
dataset so the script always runs.  Training uses BCEWithLogitsLoss and Adam;
after each epoch we compute validation loss and Matthews Correlation Coefficient
(MCC) and store them in the experiment_data dict.  All tensors and the model are
moved to GPU when available, and metrics/losses are saved as .npy files for
later analysis; a simple loss/MCC curve is also plotted to the working
directory.  This gives a fully-functional end–to-end pipeline—data loading,
training, evaluation and visualisation—forming a solid baseline that we can
iterate on in subsequent experiments.  The code obeys all device-handling,
saving and execution constraints specified in the instructions and finishes in a
few minutes on modest hardware.

A first solid baseline treats each symbolic sequence simply as a string of
characters and learns to classify accept / reject with a lightweight neural
network.  We load train / dev / test splits via the provided utility, build a
vocabulary from the training symbols, and encode every sequence as an integer
list.  A small PyTorch model – character embedding, one-layer GRU, and a sigmoid
classifier – is trained with BCE-with-logits loss.  Batches are padded on-the-
fly and everything is pushed to GPU if available, satisfying the device-handling
requirements.  After every epoch we compute Matthews Correlation Coefficient on
the dev set and print the validation loss; MCC as well as losses are tracked
inside an experiment_data dictionary that is finally saved with np.save.  We
also save dev-set predictions and a line plot of MCC across epochs into the
working directory for quick inspection.  Although simple, this end-to-end
pipeline establishes a reproducible reference point and ensures we can load
data, train, evaluate and visualise results before exploring more sophisticated
SPR reasoning models.

We will treat each SPR symbol sequence as a simple character string, build a
character-level vocabulary from the training split, and encode every sequence as
a list of integer IDs with 0 reserved for padding.  A compact PyTorch model will
serve as the baseline: an Embedding layer (dim = 64, padding_idx = 0) feeds a
single-layer bidirectional GRU (hidden = 128) whose outputs are average-pooled
across time and passed to a linear layer that produces class logits.  The model
is trained for a few epochs (default = 5) with Adam and Cross-Entropy (binary or
multi-class detected automatically).  After every epoch we compute validation
loss and the Matthews Correlation Coefficient (MCC) on the dev split, printing
and storing them.  At the end we evaluate on the held-out test set, save all
losses/metrics/predictions/ground-truth into “experiment_data.npy”, and plot the
learning curves into the working directory.  The script honours GPU
availability, moves all tensors/models appropriately, pads batches with a custom
collate_fn, and will fall back to a tiny synthetic dataset if the real benchmark
cannot be located so the code always runs.  This provides a clean, reproducible
baseline upon which more sophisticated SPR reasoning models can later be built.

import os

working_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "working")
os.makedirs(working_dir, exist_ok=True)

import pathlib, time, json, numpy as np, torch
from torch import nn
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader, Dataset
from sklearn.metrics import matthews_corrcoef
from datasets import load_dataset, DatasetDict

# ---------------- experiment data container ----------------
experiment_data = {
    "SPR_BENCH": {
        "metrics": {"train_mcc": [], "val_mcc": [], "test_mcc": []},
        "losses": {"train": [], "val": []},
        "predictions": {"val": [], "test": []},
        "ground_truth": {"val": [], "test": []},
        "epochs": [],
    }
}

# ---------------- device ----------------
device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
print(f"Using device: {device}")


# ---------------- dataset loading helper (from prompt) ----------------
def load_spr_bench(root: pathlib.Path) -> DatasetDict:
    def _load(split_csv: str):
        return load_dataset(
            "csv",
            data_files=str(root / split_csv),
            split="train",
            cache_dir=".cache_dsets",
        )

    dset = DatasetDict()
    dset["train"] = _load("train.csv")
    dset["dev"] = _load("dev.csv")
    dset["test"] = _load("test.csv")
    return dset


# adjust the path as necessary
DATA_PATH = pathlib.Path(os.getenv("SPR_PATH", "./SPR_BENCH"))
spr = load_spr_bench(DATA_PATH)
print({k: len(v) for k, v in spr.items()})

# ---------------- vocabulary build ----------------
train_sequences = spr["train"]["sequence"]
vocab = {"<pad>": 0}
for seq in train_sequences:
    for ch in seq:
        if ch not in vocab:
            vocab[ch] = len(vocab)
vocab_size = len(vocab)
print(f"Vocab size: {vocab_size}")


def encode(seq):
    return [vocab[ch] for ch in seq]


# -------------- custom torch dataset ---------------
class SPRDataset(Dataset):
    def __init__(self, hf_split):
        self.seqs = hf_split["sequence"]
        # ensure int labels
        self.labels = [int(l) for l in hf_split["label"]]

    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.seqs)

    def __getitem__(self, idx):
        return {
            "ids": torch.tensor(encode(self.seqs[idx]), dtype=torch.long),
            "label": torch.tensor(self.labels[idx], dtype=torch.long),
        }


def collate(batch):
    lengths = torch.tensor([len(item["ids"]) for item in batch], dtype=torch.long)
    max_len = lengths.max().item()
    ids_padded = torch.zeros(len(batch), max_len, dtype=torch.long)  # PAD=0
    for i, item in enumerate(batch):
        ids_padded[i, : len(item["ids"])] = item["ids"]
    labels = torch.stack([item["label"] for item in batch])
    return {
        "ids": ids_padded.to(device),
        "lengths": lengths.to(device),
        "labels": labels.to(device),
    }


# -------------- dataloaders ----------------
BATCH_SZ = 128
train_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRDataset(spr["train"]), batch_size=BATCH_SZ, shuffle=True, collate_fn=collate
)
val_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRDataset(spr["dev"]), batch_size=BATCH_SZ, shuffle=False, collate_fn=collate
)
test_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRDataset(spr["test"]), batch_size=BATCH_SZ, shuffle=False, collate_fn=collate
)


# -------------- model ----------------
class SequenceClassifier(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, vocab_size, emb_dim=64, hidden=128, num_classes=2):
        super().__init__()
        self.emb = nn.Embedding(vocab_size, emb_dim, padding_idx=0)
        self.lstm = nn.LSTM(emb_dim, hidden, batch_first=True, bidirectional=True)
        self.fc = nn.Linear(hidden * 2, num_classes)

    def forward(self, ids, lengths):
        emb = self.emb(ids)
        packed = nn.utils.rnn.pack_padded_sequence(
            emb, lengths.cpu(), batch_first=True, enforce_sorted=False
        )
        _, (h_n, _) = self.lstm(packed)
        h_final = torch.cat([h_n[-2], h_n[-1]], dim=1)
        return self.fc(h_final)


model = SequenceClassifier(vocab_size).to(device)
criterion = nn.CrossEntropyLoss()
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=1e-3)

# -------------- training loop ----------------
EPOCHS = 5
for epoch in range(1, EPOCHS + 1):
    model.train()
    epoch_loss, preds, gts = 0.0, [], []
    for batch in train_loader:
        optimizer.zero_grad()
        logits = model(batch["ids"], batch["lengths"])
        loss = criterion(logits, batch["labels"])
        loss.backward()
        optimizer.step()
        epoch_loss += loss.item() * batch["labels"].size(0)
        preds.extend(torch.argmax(logits, 1).cpu().tolist())
        gts.extend(batch["labels"].cpu().tolist())
    train_loss = epoch_loss / len(train_loader.dataset)
    train_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(gts, preds)

    # validation
    model.eval()
    val_loss, val_preds, val_gts = 0.0, [], []
    with torch.no_grad():
        for batch in val_loader:
            logits = model(batch["ids"], batch["lengths"])
            loss = criterion(logits, batch["labels"])
            val_loss += loss.item() * batch["labels"].size(0)
            val_preds.extend(torch.argmax(logits, 1).cpu().tolist())
            val_gts.extend(batch["labels"].cpu().tolist())
    val_loss = val_loss / len(val_loader.dataset)
    val_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(val_gts, val_preds)

    # logging
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"].append(epoch)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"].append(train_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"].append(val_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["train_mcc"].append(train_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_mcc"].append(val_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["predictions"]["val"] = val_preds
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["ground_truth"]["val"] = val_gts

    print(f"Epoch {epoch}: validation_loss = {val_loss:.4f} | val_MCC = {val_mcc:.4f}")

# -------------- test evaluation --------------
model.eval()
test_preds, test_gts = [], []
with torch.no_grad():
    for batch in test_loader:
        logits = model(batch["ids"], batch["lengths"])
        test_preds.extend(torch.argmax(logits, 1).cpu().tolist())
        test_gts.extend(batch["labels"].cpu().tolist())
test_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(test_gts, test_preds)
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["test_mcc"].append(test_mcc)
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["predictions"]["test"] = test_preds
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["ground_truth"]["test"] = test_gts
print(f"\nTest MCC: {test_mcc:.4f}")

# -------------- persist experiment data -------------
np.save(os.path.join(working_dir, "experiment_data.npy"), experiment_data)
print(f"Experiment data saved to {working_dir}/experiment_data.npy")
import os, pathlib, random, time, json, math
import numpy as np
import torch
from torch import nn
from torch.utils.data import Dataset, DataLoader
from datasets import load_dataset, DatasetDict
from sklearn.metrics import matthews_corrcoef
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# --- working dir -------------------------------------------------------------
working_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "working")
os.makedirs(working_dir, exist_ok=True)

# experiment data container
experiment_data = {
    "SPR_BENCH": {
        "metrics": {"train_MCC": [], "val_MCC": []},
        "losses": {"train": [], "val": []},
        "predictions": [],
        "ground_truth": [],
        "epochs": [],
    }
}

# --- device ------------------------------------------------------------------
device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
print(f"Using device: {device}")


# --- helper to load SPR_BENCH -------------------------------------------------
def load_spr_bench(root: pathlib.Path) -> DatasetDict:
    def _load(split_csv: str):
        return load_dataset(
            "csv",
            data_files=str(root / split_csv),
            split="train",
            cache_dir=".cache_dsets",
        )

    dset = DatasetDict()
    dset["train"] = _load("train.csv")
    dset["dev"] = _load("dev.csv")
    dset["test"] = _load("test.csv")
    return dset


def maybe_load_real_dataset() -> DatasetDict:
    env_path = os.getenv("SPR_PATH", "/home/zxl240011/AI-Scientist-v2/SPR_BENCH/")
    root = pathlib.Path(env_path)
    if root.exists():
        print(f"Loading real SPR_BENCH from {root}")
        return load_spr_bench(root)
    # ----------------- fallback synthetic data --------------------------
    print("Real dataset not found, generating synthetic toy dataset...")

    def synth_split(n):
        seqs, labels = [], []
        syms = list("ABCDEFGH")
        for _ in range(n):
            length = random.randint(5, 12)
            seq = "".join(random.choice(syms) for _ in range(length))
            label = int(seq.count("A") % 2 == 0)  # simple parity rule on 'A'
            seqs.append(seq)
            labels.append(label)
        return {"id": list(range(n)), "sequence": seqs, "label": labels}

    dset = DatasetDict()
    dset["train"] = load_dataset(
        "json", data_files={"train": []}, split="train"
    )  # dummy init
    for split, n in [("train", 2000), ("dev", 500), ("test", 500)]:
        tmp = synth_split(n)
        dset[split] = load_dataset("json", data_files={"train": []}, split="train")
        dset[split] = dset[split].add_item(tmp)
    # HuggingFace Dataset concat hack – simpler: convert manually:
    for split, n in [("train", 2000), ("dev", 500), ("test", 500)]:
        d = synth_split(n)
        dset[split] = load_dataset("csv", data_files={"train": []}, split="train")
    # Easier: build by hand into Dataset.from_dict
    from datasets import Dataset as HFDataset

    dset = DatasetDict()
    for split, n in [("train", 2000), ("dev", 500), ("test", 500)]:
        dset[split] = HFDataset.from_dict(synth_split(n))
    return dset


spr_bench = maybe_load_real_dataset()
print("Loaded splits:", spr_bench.keys())

# --- vocabulary --------------------------------------------------------------
all_text = "".join(spr_bench["train"]["sequence"])
vocab = sorted(set(all_text))
stoi = {ch: i + 1 for i, ch in enumerate(vocab)}  # 0 reserved for PAD
itos = {i: ch for ch, i in stoi.items()}
pad_idx = 0
max_len = min(40, max(len(s) for s in spr_bench["train"]["sequence"]))


def encode(seq):
    ids = [stoi.get(c, 0) for c in seq[:max_len]]
    if len(ids) < max_len:
        ids += [pad_idx] * (max_len - len(ids))
    return ids


# --- PyTorch dataset ---------------------------------------------------------
class SPRTorch(Dataset):
    def __init__(self, hf_dataset):
        self.seqs = hf_dataset["sequence"]
        self.labels = hf_dataset["label"]

    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.seqs)

    def __getitem__(self, idx):
        return {
            "x": torch.tensor(encode(self.seqs[idx]), dtype=torch.long),
            "y": torch.tensor(self.labels[idx], dtype=torch.float32),
        }


train_ds = SPRTorch(spr_bench["train"])
val_ds = SPRTorch(spr_bench["dev"])
test_ds = SPRTorch(spr_bench["test"])

train_loader = DataLoader(train_ds, batch_size=128, shuffle=True)
val_loader = DataLoader(val_ds, batch_size=256)


# --- model -------------------------------------------------------------------
class CharBiLSTM(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, vocab_size, emb_dim=32, hidden=64):
        super().__init__()
        self.emb = nn.Embedding(vocab_size + 1, emb_dim, padding_idx=pad_idx)
        self.lstm = nn.LSTM(emb_dim, hidden, batch_first=True, bidirectional=True)
        self.fc = nn.Linear(hidden * 2, 1)

    def forward(self, x):
        emb = self.emb(x)  # (B, L, E)
        out, _ = self.lstm(emb)  # (B, L, 2H)
        pooled = out.mean(dim=1)  # simple mean pool
        logits = self.fc(pooled).squeeze(1)  # (B,)
        return logits


model = CharBiLSTM(len(vocab)).to(device)
criterion = nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss()
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=1e-3)

# --- training loop -----------------------------------------------------------
epochs = 5
for epoch in range(1, epochs + 1):
    model.train()
    running_loss, preds, truths = 0.0, [], []
    for batch in train_loader:
        batch = {k: v.to(device) for k, v in batch.items()}
        optimizer.zero_grad()
        logits = model(batch["x"])
        loss = criterion(logits, batch["y"])
        loss.backward()
        optimizer.step()
        running_loss += loss.item() * batch["x"].size(0)
        preds.extend(torch.sigmoid(logits).detach().cpu().numpy() > 0.5)
        truths.extend(batch["y"].detach().cpu().numpy())
    train_loss = running_loss / len(train_ds)
    train_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(truths, preds)

    # ---- validation ----
    model.eval()
    val_loss_term, v_preds, v_truths = 0.0, [], []
    with torch.no_grad():
        for batch in val_loader:
            batch = {k: v.to(device) for k, v in batch.items()}
            logits = model(batch["x"])
            loss = criterion(logits, batch["y"])
            val_loss_term += loss.item() * batch["x"].size(0)
            v_preds.extend(torch.sigmoid(logits).cpu().numpy() > 0.5)
            v_truths.extend(batch["y"].cpu().numpy())
    val_loss = val_loss_term / len(val_ds)
    val_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(v_truths, v_preds)

    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"].append(train_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"].append(val_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["train_MCC"].append(train_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_MCC"].append(val_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"].append(epoch)

    print(
        f"Epoch {epoch}: train_loss={train_loss:.4f}, val_loss={val_loss:.4f}, val_MCC={val_mcc:.4f}"
    )

# --- final evaluation on test ------------------------------------------------
test_loader = DataLoader(test_ds, batch_size=256)
model.eval()
t_preds, t_truths = [], []
with torch.no_grad():
    for batch in test_loader:
        batch = {k: v.to(device) for k, v in batch.items()}
        logits = model(batch["x"])
        t_preds.extend(torch.sigmoid(logits).cpu().numpy() > 0.5)
        t_truths.extend(batch["y"].cpu().numpy())
test_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(t_truths, t_preds)
print(f"Test MCC: {test_mcc:.4f}")
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["test_MCC"] = test_mcc
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["predictions"] = t_preds
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["ground_truth"] = t_truths

# --- save metrics ------------------------------------------------------------
np.save(os.path.join(working_dir, "experiment_data.npy"), experiment_data)

# --- visualisation -----------------------------------------------------------
epochs_range = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"]
train_loss = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"]
val_loss = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"]
plt.figure()
plt.plot(epochs_range, train_loss, label="train_loss")
plt.plot(epochs_range, val_loss, label="val_loss")
plt.xlabel("epoch")
plt.ylabel("loss")
plt.legend()
plt.title("Loss Curve")
plt.savefig(os.path.join(working_dir, "loss_curve.png"))

val_mccs = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_MCC"]
plt.figure()
plt.plot(epochs_range, val_mccs, label="val_MCC")
plt.xlabel("epoch")
plt.ylabel("MCC")
plt.legend()
plt.title("Validation MCC")
plt.savefig(os.path.join(working_dir, "mcc_curve.png"))
import os, pathlib, time, json, math
import numpy as np
import torch
from torch import nn
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader
from torch.nn.utils.rnn import pad_sequence
from datasets import ClassLabel
from sklearn.metrics import matthews_corrcoef
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# ---------- required working directory ----------
working_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "working")
os.makedirs(working_dir, exist_ok=True)

# ---------- device ----------
device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
print(f"Using device: {device}")

# ---------- experiment data container ----------
experiment_data = {
    "SPR_BENCH": {
        "metrics": {"train_mcc": [], "val_mcc": []},
        "losses": {"train": [], "val": []},
        "predictions": [],
        "ground_truth": [],
        "epochs": [],
    }
}

# ---------- load dataset ----------
from SPR import load_spr_bench

DATA_PATH = pathlib.Path(os.getenv("SPR_DATA_DIR", "SPR_BENCH"))
if not DATA_PATH.exists():
    raise FileNotFoundError(
        f"Cannot find SPR_BENCH data at {DATA_PATH}. "
        "Either place it there or set SPR_DATA_DIR env."
    )
dset = load_spr_bench(DATA_PATH)
print("Loaded dataset splits:", list(dset.keys()))


# Ensure label column is int
def _ensure_int(example):
    example["label"] = int(example["label"])
    return example


for split in dset.keys():
    dset[split] = dset[split].map(_ensure_int)

# ---------- build vocabulary ----------
all_text = "".join(dset["train"]["sequence"])
vocab = sorted(list(set(all_text)))
stoi = {c: i + 1 for i, c in enumerate(vocab)}  # reserve 0 for PAD
itos = {i: c for c, i in stoi.items()}
vocab_size = len(stoi) + 1
print(f"Vocab size: {vocab_size-1}")


def encode(seq):
    return [stoi[ch] for ch in seq]


# ---------- PyTorch Dataset wrapper ----------
class SPRTorchDataset(torch.utils.data.Dataset):
    def __init__(self, hf_dataset):
        self.data = hf_dataset

    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.data)

    def __getitem__(self, idx):
        seq = self.data[idx]["sequence"]
        lab = self.data[idx]["label"]
        return torch.tensor(encode(seq), dtype=torch.long), torch.tensor(
            lab, dtype=torch.float
        )


def collate_fn(batch):
    seqs, labs = zip(*batch)
    seqs_padded = pad_sequence(seqs, batch_first=True, padding_value=0)
    lengths = torch.tensor([len(s) for s in seqs], dtype=torch.long)
    labs = torch.stack(labs)
    return {"seqs": seqs_padded, "lengths": lengths, "labels": labs}


batch_size = 128
train_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRTorchDataset(dset["train"]),
    batch_size=batch_size,
    shuffle=True,
    collate_fn=collate_fn,
)
val_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRTorchDataset(dset["dev"]),
    batch_size=batch_size,
    shuffle=False,
    collate_fn=collate_fn,
)
test_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRTorchDataset(dset["test"]),
    batch_size=batch_size,
    shuffle=False,
    collate_fn=collate_fn,
)


# ---------- model ----------
class CharGRU(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, vocab_sz, embed_dim=32, hidden=64):
        super().__init__()
        self.embed = nn.Embedding(vocab_sz, embed_dim, padding_idx=0)
        self.gru = nn.GRU(embed_dim, hidden, batch_first=True)
        self.fc = nn.Linear(hidden, 1)

    def forward(self, x, lengths):
        emb = self.embed(x)
        packed = nn.utils.rnn.pack_padded_sequence(
            emb, lengths.cpu(), batch_first=True, enforce_sorted=False
        )
        _, h_n = self.gru(packed)
        logits = self.fc(h_n.squeeze(0))
        return logits.squeeze(1)


model = CharGRU(vocab_size).to(device)
criterion = nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss()
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=1e-3)

# ---------- training loop ----------
epochs = 10


def evaluate(loader):
    model.eval()
    preds, gts, losses = [], [], []
    with torch.no_grad():
        for batch in loader:
            batch = {
                k: (v.to(device) if isinstance(v, torch.Tensor) else v)
                for k, v in batch.items()
            }
            logits = model(batch["seqs"], batch["lengths"])
            loss = criterion(logits, batch["labels"])
            losses.append(loss.item())
            preds.append(torch.sigmoid(logits).cpu())
            gts.append(batch["labels"].cpu())
    preds = torch.cat(preds).numpy()
    gts = torch.cat(gts).numpy()
    mcc = matthews_corrcoef(gts, (preds > 0.5).astype(int))
    return np.mean(losses), mcc, preds, gts


for epoch in range(1, epochs + 1):
    model.train()
    epoch_losses = []
    for batch in train_loader:
        batch = {

        loss = criterion(logits, batch["labels"])
        loss.backward()

        epoch_losses.append(loss.item())

    train_loss = np.mean(epoch_losses)

# ---------- final evaluation on test ----------
test_loss, test_mcc, test_preds, test_gts = evaluate(test_loader)

experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["test_mcc"] = test_mcc

import os, pathlib, random, math, time, json, itertools
import numpy as np
import torch
from torch import nn
from torch.utils.data import Dataset, DataLoader
from datasets import load_dataset, DatasetDict
from sklearn.metrics import matthews_corrcoef
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# mandatory working directory & experiment data container
working_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "working")
os.makedirs(working_dir, exist_ok=True)
experiment_data = {
    "SPR_BENCH": {
        "metrics": {"train_MCC": [], "val_MCC": []},
        "losses": {"train": [], "val": []},
        "predictions": [],
        "ground_truth": [],
        "epochs": [],
    }
}

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# GPU / CPU handling
device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
print(f"Using device: {device}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# SPR dataset loader (from prompt)
def load_spr_bench(root: pathlib.Path) -> DatasetDict:
    def _load(split_csv: str):
        return load_dataset(
            "csv",
            data_files=str(root / split_csv),
            split="train",
            cache_dir=".cache_dsets",
        )

    dset = DatasetDict()
    dset["train"] = _load("train.csv")
    dset["dev"] = _load("dev.csv")
    dset["test"] = _load("test.csv")
    return dset


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# try loading real benchmark; otherwise make synthetic toy data
def get_dataset():
    possible_paths = [
        pathlib.Path("SPR_BENCH"),
        pathlib.Path("./SPR_BENCH"),
        pathlib.Path("/home/zxl240011/AI-Scientist-v2/SPR_BENCH/"),
    ]
    for p in possible_paths:
        if (p / "train.csv").exists():
            print(f"Loading dataset from {p}")
            return load_spr_bench(p)
    print("WARNING: SPR_BENCH not found, creating synthetic dataset for demo.")

    def make_split(n):
        ids = list(range(n))
        seqs = [
            "".join(random.choice(list("ABCDEF")) for _ in range(random.randint(5, 15)))
            for _ in ids
        ]
        labels = [int(sum(ord(c) for c in s) % 2 == 0) for s in seqs]
        return {"id": ids, "sequence": seqs, "label": labels}

    d = DatasetDict()
    d["train"] = load_dataset(
        "json",
        data_files={"train": [json.dumps(x) for x in [make_split(5000)]]},
        split="train",
    )
    d["dev"] = load_dataset(
        "json",
        data_files={"train": [json.dumps(x) for x in [make_split(1000)]]},
        split="train",
    )
    d["test"] = load_dataset(
        "json",
        data_files={"train": [json.dumps(x) for x in [make_split(1000)]]},
        split="train",
    )
    return d


spr = get_dataset()


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Build vocabulary
def build_vocab(dataset):
    chars = set()
    for s in dataset["sequence"]:
        chars.update(set(s))
    vocab = {ch: i + 1 for i, ch in enumerate(sorted(chars))}  # 0 is PAD
    vocab["<PAD>"] = 0
    return vocab


vocab = build_vocab(spr["train"])
print(f"Vocab size = {len(vocab)}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Torch dataset
class SPRTorchDataset(Dataset):
    def __init__(self, hf_split, vocab):
        self.seqs = hf_split["sequence"]
        self.labels = [int(x) for x in hf_split["label"]]
        self.vocab = vocab

    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.seqs)

    def encode(self, s):
        return [self.vocab[ch] for ch in s]

    def __getitem__(self, idx):
        seq = torch.tensor(self.encode(self.seqs[idx]), dtype=torch.long)
        label = torch.tensor(self.labels[idx], dtype=torch.long)
        return {"seq": seq, "label": label}


def collate_fn(batch):
    seqs = [b["seq"] for b in batch]
    labels = torch.stack([b["label"] for b in batch])
    lengths = torch.tensor([len(s) for s in seqs], dtype=torch.long)
    max_len = max(lengths)
    padded = torch.zeros(len(seqs), max_len, dtype=torch.long)
    for i, s in enumerate(seqs):
        padded[i, : len(s)] = s
    return {"seq": padded, "lengths": lengths, "label": labels}


batch_size = 128
train_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRTorchDataset(spr["train"], vocab),
    batch_size=batch_size,
    shuffle=True,
    collate_fn=collate_fn,
)
dev_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRTorchDataset(spr["dev"], vocab),
    batch_size=batch_size,
    shuffle=False,
    collate_fn=collate_fn,
)
test_loader = DataLoader(
    SPRTorchDataset(spr["test"], vocab),
    batch_size=batch_size,
    shuffle=False,
    collate_fn=collate_fn,
)

num_classes = len(set(spr["train"]["label"]))
print(f"Number of classes: {num_classes}")


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Model
class SPRClassifier(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, vocab_size, embed_dim=64, hidden=128, num_classes=2):
        super().__init__()
        self.embed = nn.Embedding(vocab_size, embed_dim, padding_idx=0)
        self.gru = nn.GRU(embed_dim, hidden, batch_first=True, bidirectional=True)
        self.fc = nn.Linear(hidden * 2, num_classes)

    def forward(self, x, lengths):
        emb = self.embed(x)  # [B,L,E]
        packed = nn.utils.rnn.pack_padded_sequence(
            emb, lengths.cpu(), batch_first=True, enforce_sorted=False
        )
        out, _ = self.gru(packed)
        out, _ = nn.utils.rnn.pad_packed_sequence(out, batch_first=True)
        mask = (x != 0).unsqueeze(-1)
        out = out * mask  # zero-out paddings
        mean = out.sum(1) / mask.sum(1).clamp(min=1)
        return self.fc(mean)


model = SPRClassifier(len(vocab), num_classes=num_classes).to(device)
criterion = nn.CrossEntropyLoss() if num_classes > 2 else nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss()
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=1e-3)


# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
def epoch_run(loader, train=False):
    if train:
        model.train()
    else:
        model.eval()
    total_loss, y_true, y_pred = 0.0, [], []
    with torch.set_grad_enabled(train):
        for batch in loader:
            batch = {
                k: (v.to(device) if isinstance(v, torch.Tensor) else v)
                for k, v in batch.items()
            }
            logits = model(batch["seq"], batch["lengths"])
            if num_classes > 2:
                loss = criterion(logits, batch["label"])
                pred = torch.argmax(logits, dim=1)
            else:
                labels = batch["label"].float().unsqueeze(1)
                loss = criterion(logits, labels)
                pred = (torch.sigmoid(logits) > 0.5).long().squeeze(1)
            if train:
                optimizer.zero_grad()
                loss.backward()
                optimizer.step()
            total_loss += loss.item() * batch["seq"].size(0)
            y_true.extend(batch["label"].cpu().numpy().tolist())
            y_pred.extend(pred.detach().cpu().numpy().tolist())
    avg_loss = total_loss / len(loader.dataset)
    mcc = matthews_corrcoef(y_true, y_pred) if len(set(y_true)) > 1 else 0.0
    return avg_loss, mcc, y_true, y_pred


num_epochs = 5
for epoch in range(1, num_epochs + 1):
    train_loss, train_mcc, _, _ = epoch_run(train_loader, train=True)
    val_loss, val_mcc, _, _ = epoch_run(dev_loader, train=False)

    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"].append(train_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"].append(val_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["train_MCC"].append(train_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_MCC"].append(val_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"].append(epoch)

    print(
        f"Epoch {epoch}: train_loss={train_loss:.4f}, val_loss={val_loss:.4f}, "
        f"train_MCC={train_mcc:.3f}, val_MCC={val_mcc:.3f}"
    )

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Final test evaluation
test_loss, test_mcc, y_true_test, y_pred_test = epoch_run(test_loader, train=False)
print(f"\nTEST  : loss={test_loss:.4f},  MCC={test_mcc:.3f}")

experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["predictions"] = y_pred_test
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["ground_truth"] = y_true_test
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["test_loss"] = test_loss
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["test_MCC"] = test_mcc

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Save experiment data
np.save(os.path.join(working_dir, "experiment_data.npy"), experiment_data)

# ---------------------------------------------------------------------
# Plotting learning curves
plt.figure(figsize=(6, 4))
plt.plot(
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"],
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"],
    label="train loss",
)
plt.plot(
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"],
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"],
    label="val loss",
)
plt.xlabel("Epoch")
plt.ylabel("Loss")
plt.legend()
plt.title("Loss curve")
plt.savefig(os.path.join(working_dir, "loss_curve.png"), dpi=150)

plt.figure(figsize=(6, 4))
plt.plot(
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"],
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["train_MCC"],
    label="train MCC",
)
plt.plot(
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"],
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_MCC"],
    label="val MCC",
)
plt.xlabel("Epoch")
plt.ylabel("MCC")
plt.legend()
plt.title("MCC curve")
plt.savefig(os.path.join(working_dir, "mcc_curve.png"), dpi=150)
print(f"Plots saved in {working_dir}")

# experiment data container
experiment_data = {

        "metrics": {"train_MCC": [], "val_MCC": []},
        "losses": {"train": [], "val": []},
        "predictions": [],
        "ground_truth": [],
        "epochs": [],
    }
}

# --- device ------------------------------------------------------------------
device = torch.device("cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu")
print(f"Using device: {device}")


# --- helper to load SPR_BENCH -------------------------------------------------
def load_spr_bench(root: pathlib.Path) -> DatasetDict:
    def _load(split_csv: str):
        return load_dataset(
            "csv",
            data_files=str(root / split_csv),
            split="train",
            cache_dir=".cache_dsets",
        )

    dset = DatasetDict()
    dset["train"] = _load("train.csv")
    dset["dev"] = _load("dev.csv")
    dset["test"] = _load("test.csv")
    return dset


def maybe_load_real_dataset() -> DatasetDict:
    env_path = os.getenv("SPR_PATH", "/home/zxl240011/AI-Scientist-v2/SPR_BENCH/")
    root = pathlib.Path(env_path)
    if root.exists():
        print(f"Loading real SPR_BENCH from {root}")
        return load_spr_bench(root)
    # ----------------- fallback synthetic data --------------------------
    print("Real dataset not found, generating synthetic toy dataset...")

    def synth_split(n):
        seqs, labels = [], []
        syms = list("ABCDEFGH")
        for _ in range(n):
            length = random.randint(5, 12)
            seq = "".join(random.choice(syms) for _ in range(length))
            label = int(seq.count("A") % 2 == 0)  # simple parity rule on 'A'
            seqs.append(seq)
            labels.append(label)
        return {"id": list(range(n)), "sequence": seqs, "label": labels}

    dset = DatasetDict()
    dset["train"] = load_dataset(
        "json", data_files={"train": []}, split="train"
    )  # dummy init
    for split, n in [("train", 2000), ("dev", 500), ("test", 500)]:
        tmp = synth_split(n)
        dset[split] = load_dataset("json", data_files={"train": []}, split="train")
        dset[split] = dset[split].add_item(tmp)
    # HuggingFace Dataset concat hack – simpler: convert manually:
    for split, n in [("train", 2000), ("dev", 500), ("test", 500)]:
        d = synth_split(n)
        dset[split] = load_dataset("csv", data_files={"train": []}, split="train")
    # Easier: build by hand into Dataset.from_dict
    from datasets import Dataset as HFDataset

    dset = DatasetDict()
    for split, n in [("train", 2000), ("dev", 500), ("test", 500)]:
        dset[split] = HFDataset.from_dict(synth_split(n))
    return dset


spr_bench = maybe_load_real_dataset()
print("Loaded splits:", spr_bench.keys())

# --- vocabulary --------------------------------------------------------------
all_text = "".join(spr_bench["train"]["sequence"])
vocab = sorted(set(all_text))
stoi = {ch: i + 1 for i, ch in enumerate(vocab)}  # 0 reserved for PAD
itos = {i: ch for ch, i in stoi.items()}
pad_idx = 0
max_len = min(40, max(len(s) for s in spr_bench["train"]["sequence"]))


def encode(seq):
    ids = [stoi.get(c, 0) for c in seq[:max_len]]
    if len(ids) < max_len:
        ids += [pad_idx] * (max_len - len(ids))
    return ids


# --- PyTorch dataset ---------------------------------------------------------
class SPRTorch(Dataset):
    def __init__(self, hf_dataset):
        self.seqs = hf_dataset["sequence"]
        self.labels = hf_dataset["label"]

    def __len__(self):
        return len(self.seqs)

    def __getitem__(self, idx):
        return {
            "x": torch.tensor(encode(self.seqs[idx]), dtype=torch.long),
            "y": torch.tensor(self.labels[idx], dtype=torch.float32),
        }


train_ds = SPRTorch(spr_bench["train"])
val_ds = SPRTorch(spr_bench["dev"])
test_ds = SPRTorch(spr_bench["test"])

train_loader = DataLoader(train_ds, batch_size=128, shuffle=True)
val_loader = DataLoader(val_ds, batch_size=256)


# --- model -------------------------------------------------------------------
class CharBiLSTM(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, vocab_size, emb_dim=32, hidden=64):
        super().__init__()
        self.emb = nn.Embedding(vocab_size + 1, emb_dim, padding_idx=pad_idx)
        self.lstm = nn.LSTM(emb_dim, hidden, batch_first=True, bidirectional=True)
        self.fc = nn.Linear(hidden * 2, 1)

    def forward(self, x):
        emb = self.emb(x)  # (B, L, E)
        out, _ = self.lstm(emb)  # (B, L, 2H)
        pooled = out.mean(dim=1)  # simple mean pool
        logits = self.fc(pooled).squeeze(1)  # (B,)
        return logits


model = CharBiLSTM(len(vocab)).to(device)
criterion = nn.BCEWithLogitsLoss()
optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.parameters(), lr=1e-3)

# --- training loop -----------------------------------------------------------
epochs = 5
for epoch in range(1, epochs + 1):
    model.train()
    running_loss, preds, truths = 0.0, [], []
    for batch in train_loader:
        batch = {k: v.to(device) for k, v in batch.items()}
        optimizer.zero_grad()
        logits = model(batch["x"])
        loss = criterion(logits, batch["y"])
        loss.backward()
        optimizer.step()
        running_loss += loss.item() * batch["x"].size(0)
        preds.extend(torch.sigmoid(logits).detach().cpu().numpy() > 0.5)
        truths.extend(batch["y"].detach().cpu().numpy())
    train_loss = running_loss / len(train_ds)
    train_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(truths, preds)

    # ---- validation ----
    model.eval()
    val_loss_term, v_preds, v_truths = 0.0, [], []
    with torch.no_grad():
        for batch in val_loader:
            batch = {k: v.to(device) for k, v in batch.items()}
            logits = model(batch["x"])
            loss = criterion(logits, batch["y"])
            val_loss_term += loss.item() * batch["x"].size(0)
            v_preds.extend(torch.sigmoid(logits).cpu().numpy() > 0.5)
            v_truths.extend(batch["y"].cpu().numpy())
    val_loss = val_loss_term / len(val_ds)
    val_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(v_truths, v_preds)

    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"].append(train_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"].append(val_loss)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["train_MCC"].append(train_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_MCC"].append(val_mcc)
    experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"].append(epoch)

    print(
        f"Epoch {epoch}: train_loss={train_loss:.4f}, val_loss={val_loss:.4f}, val_MCC={val_mcc:.4f}"
    )

# --- final evaluation on test ------------------------------------------------
test_loader = DataLoader(test_ds, batch_size=256)
model.eval()
t_preds, t_truths = [], []
with torch.no_grad():
    for batch in test_loader:
        batch = {k: v.to(device) for k, v in batch.items()}
        logits = model(batch["x"])
        t_preds.extend(torch.sigmoid(logits).cpu().numpy() > 0.5)
        t_truths.extend(batch["y"].cpu().numpy())
test_mcc = matthews_corrcoef(t_truths, t_preds)
print(f"Test MCC: {test_mcc:.4f}")
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["test_MCC"] = test_mcc
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["predictions"] = t_preds
experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["ground_truth"] = t_truths

# --- save metrics ------------------------------------------------------------
np.save(os.path.join(working_dir, "experiment_data.npy"), experiment_data)

# --- visualisation -----------------------------------------------------------
epochs_range = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["epochs"]
train_loss = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["train"]
val_loss = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["losses"]["val"]

plt.plot(epochs_range, val_loss, label="val_loss")
plt.xlabel("epoch")
plt.ylabel("loss")
plt.legend()
plt.title("Loss Curve")
plt.savefig(os.path.join(working_dir, "loss_curve.png"))

val_mccs = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]["metrics"]["val_MCC"]

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
import os

# --- setup -------------------------------------------------------------------
working_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "working")
os.makedirs(working_dir, exist_ok=True)

# load experiment data
try:
    exp_path = os.path.join(working_dir, "experiment_data.npy")
    experiment_data = np.load(exp_path, allow_pickle=True).item()
    data = experiment_data["SPR_BENCH"]
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error loading experiment data: {e}")
    raise SystemExit

epochs = data["epochs"]
train_loss = data["losses"]["train"]
val_loss = data["losses"]["val"]
train_mcc = data["metrics"]["train_MCC"]
val_mcc = data["metrics"]["val_MCC"]
test_pred = np.array(data["predictions"])
test_true = np.array(data["ground_truth"])

# 1) loss curve ---------------------------------------------------------------
try:
    plt.figure()
    plt.plot(epochs, train_loss, label="Train Loss")
    plt.plot(epochs, val_loss, label="Validation Loss")
    plt.xlabel("Epoch")
    plt.ylabel("BCE Loss")
    plt.title("SPR_BENCH – Loss Curve")
    plt.legend()
    save_path = os.path.join(working_dir, "SPR_BENCH_loss_curve.png")
    plt.savefig(save_path)
    plt.close()
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error creating loss curve: {e}")
    plt.close()

# 2) MCC curve ----------------------------------------------------------------
try:
    plt.figure()
    plt.plot(epochs, train_mcc, label="Train MCC")
    plt.plot(epochs, val_mcc, label="Validation MCC")
    plt.xlabel("Epoch")
    plt.ylabel("Matthews Corr. Coef.")
    plt.title("SPR_BENCH – MCC Curve")
    plt.legend()
    save_path = os.path.join(working_dir, "SPR_BENCH_MCC_curve.png")
    plt.savefig(save_path)
    plt.close()
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error creating MCC curve: {e}")
    plt.close()

# 3) Test confusion matrix (bar) ---------------------------------------------
try:
    tp = int(((test_pred == 1) & (test_true == 1)).sum())
    tn = int(((test_pred == 0) & (test_true == 0)).sum())
    fp = int(((test_pred == 1) & (test_true == 0)).sum())
    fn = int(((test_pred == 0) & (test_true == 1)).sum())
    counts = [tp, tn, fp, fn]
    labels = ["TP", "TN", "FP", "FN"]
    plt.figure()
    plt.bar(labels, counts, color=["green", "blue", "orange", "red"])
    for idx, c in enumerate(counts):
        plt.text(idx, c + 0.5, str(c), ha="center")
    plt.ylabel("Count")
    plt.title("SPR_BENCH – Test Confusion Matrix")
    save_path = os.path.join(working_dir, "SPR_BENCH_confusion_matrix.png")
    plt.savefig(save_path)
    plt.close()
except Exception as e:
    print(f"Error creating confusion matrix: {e}")
    plt.close()

# quick console confirmation
print("Plotted epochs:", epochs)
print("Train loss:", train_loss)
print("Val loss:", val_loss)
print("Train MCC:", train_mcc)
print("Val MCC:", val_mcc)

    "experiments/2025-08-17_18-47-55_symblic_polyrule_reasoning_attempt_0/logs/0-run/experiment_results/experiment_efa10bfdb5d14392acfe951e5d3c67d4_proc_3327624/experiment_data.npy",
]

# ----------------------------------------------------------------- loading --
all_experiment_data = []
for p in experiment_data_path_list:
    try:
        full_path = os.path.join(os.getenv("AI_SCIENTIST_ROOT", ""), p)
        exp_d = np.load(full_path, allow_pickle=True).item()
        all_experiment_data.append(exp_d)
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error loading {p}: {e}")

if len(all_experiment_data) == 0:
    raise SystemExit("No experiment data could be loaded.")

# -------------------------------------------------------------- aggregation --
# discover shared dataset names
dataset_names = set.intersection(*[set(ed.keys()) for ed in all_experiment_data])

for dset in dataset_names:
    # Gather per-run tensors
    loss_train_runs, loss_val_runs = [], []
    mcc_train_runs, mcc_val_runs = [], []
    epochs_ref = None
    cm_counts = []  # TP,TN,FP,FN per run

    for run_idx, ed in enumerate(all_experiment_data):
        try:
            data = ed[dset]
            epochs = np.asarray(data["epochs"])
            if epochs_ref is None:
                epochs_ref = epochs
            # only keep runs that have identical epoch length
            if len(epochs) != len(epochs_ref):
                print(f"Skipping run {run_idx} for {dset}: mismatched epochs.")
                continue
            loss_train_runs.append(np.asarray(data["losses"]["train"]))
            loss_val_runs.append(np.asarray(data["losses"]["val"]))
            mcc_train_runs.append(np.asarray(data["metrics"]["train_MCC"]))
            mcc_val_runs.append(np.asarray(data["metrics"]["val_MCC"]))

            # confusion matrix
            preds = np.asarray(data["predictions"])
            gts = np.asarray(data["ground_truth"])
            tp = int(((preds == 1) & (gts == 1)).sum())
            tn = int(((preds == 0) & (gts == 0)).sum())
            fp = int(((preds == 1) & (gts == 0)).sum())
            fn = int(((preds == 0) & (gts == 1)).sum())
            cm_counts.append([tp, tn, fp, fn])
        except Exception as e:
            print(f"Run {run_idx} missing keys for {dset}: {e}")

    # convert to arrays
    def stack_and_stats(lst):
        arr = np.stack(lst, axis=0)  # shape (runs, epochs)
        mean = arr.mean(axis=0)
        sem = (
            arr.std(axis=0, ddof=1) / math.sqrt(arr.shape[0])
            if arr.shape[0] > 1
            else np.zeros_like(mean)
        )
        return mean, sem

    if len(loss_train_runs) == 0:
        print(f"No complete runs for {dset}, skipping plotting.")
        continue

    m_train, s_train = stack_and_stats(loss_train_runs)
    m_val, s_val = stack_and_stats(loss_val_runs)
    m_mcc_tr, s_mcc_tr = stack_and_stats(mcc_train_runs)
    m_mcc_val, s_mcc_val = stack_and_stats(mcc_val_runs)

    # ----------------------------------------------------------- plot losses
    try:
        plt.figure()
        plt.plot(epochs_ref, m_train, label="Train Loss mean")
        plt.fill_between(
            epochs_ref,
            m_train - s_train,
            m_train + s_train,
            alpha=0.25,
            label="Train Loss ± SEM",
        )
        plt.plot(epochs_ref, m_val, label="Val Loss mean")
        plt.fill_between(
            epochs_ref, m_val - s_val, m_val + s_val, alpha=0.25, label="Val Loss ± SEM"
        )
        plt.xlabel("Epoch")
        plt.ylabel("BCE Loss")
        plt.title(
            f"{dset} – Aggregated Loss Curve\n(Mean ± SEM over {len(loss_train_runs)} runs)"
        )
        plt.legend()
        save_path = os.path.join(working_dir, f"{dset}_agg_loss_curve.png")
        plt.savefig(save_path)
        plt.close()
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error creating aggregated loss for {dset}: {e}")
        plt.close()

    # ----------------------------------------------------------- plot MCC
    try:
        plt.figure()
        plt.plot(epochs_ref, m_mcc_tr, label="Train MCC mean")
        plt.fill_between(
            epochs_ref,
            m_mcc_tr - s_mcc_tr,
            m_mcc_tr + s_mcc_tr,
            alpha=0.25,
            label="Train MCC ± SEM",
        )
        plt.plot(epochs_ref, m_mcc_val, label="Val MCC mean")
        plt.fill_between(
            epochs_ref,
            m_mcc_val - s_mcc_val,
            m_mcc_val + s_mcc_val,
            alpha=0.25,
            label="Val MCC ± SEM",
        )
        plt.xlabel("Epoch")
        plt.ylabel("Matthews Corr. Coef.")
        plt.title(
            f"{dset} – Aggregated MCC Curve\n(Mean ± SEM over {len(mcc_train_runs)} runs)"
        )
        plt.legend()
        save_path = os.path.join(working_dir, f"{dset}_agg_MCC_curve.png")
        plt.savefig(save_path)
        plt.close()
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error creating aggregated MCC for {dset}: {e}")
        plt.close()

    # --------------------------------------- aggregated confusion-matrix bar
    try:
        cm_arr = np.asarray(cm_counts)  # shape (runs, 4)
        cm_mean = cm_arr.mean(axis=0)
        cm_sem = (
            cm_arr.std(axis=0, ddof=1) / math.sqrt(cm_arr.shape[0])
            if cm_arr.shape[0] > 1
            else np.zeros_like(cm_mean)
        )
        labels = ["TP", "TN", "FP", "FN"]
        plt.figure()
        plt.bar(
            labels,
            cm_mean,
            yerr=cm_sem,
            capsize=5,
            color=["green", "blue", "orange", "red"],
        )
        for idx, val in enumerate(cm_mean):
            plt.text(idx, val + max(cm_sem[idx], 1e-3), f"{val:.1f}", ha="center")
        plt.ylabel("Count (mean)")
        plt.title(
            f"{dset} – Aggregated Confusion Matrix\n(Mean ± SEM over {cm_arr.shape[0]} runs)"
        )
        save_path = os.path.join(working_dir, f"{dset}_agg_confusion_matrix.png")
        plt.savefig(save_path)
        plt.close()
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error creating aggregated confusion matrix for {dset}: {e}")
        plt.close()

    # ----------------------------------------- console summary (final epoch)
    final_val_mcc_mean = m_mcc_val[-1]
    final_val_mcc_sem = s_mcc_val[-1]
    print(
        f"{dset}: final-epoch Val MCC = {final_val_mcc_mean:.4f} ± {final_val_mcc_sem:.4f} (mean ± SEM, N={len(mcc_val_runs)})"
    )
plot_plan: We first load the serialized experiment_data.npy file and extract the lists of epochs, losses, MCC scores and the test‐set predictions/labels belonging to the “SPR_BENCH” entry.  Three straightforward visualisations are produced.  (1) A line plot of train vs. validation loss across epochs allows quick inspection of convergence and over-fitting.  (2) A second line plot juxtaposes train and validation MCC to trace the evolution of discriminative performance.  (3) Using the boolean test predictions and ground-truth labels we aggregate TP, TN, FP, FN counts and draw a small bar chart that conveys the final confusion matrix.  Each figure is generated inside its own try-except block, saved under a descriptive filename in working_dir and closed immediately afterward, fully complying with the plotting guidelines.  No synthetic data are fabricated—everything comes directly from the stored experiment dictionary.  The script is short, standard matplotlib is employed without custom styles, and an informative title is added to every figure.  Finally, the script prints the arrays it plotted so that the user can quickly confirm which metric corresponds to which curve.

This script loads the saved experiment data, walks through every dataset entry,
and prints a concise summary of the key results. For each dataset it reports the
minimum training loss, minimum validation loss, maximum training MCC, maximum
validation MCC, and the final test MCC. Values are clearly labeled so they can
be read unambiguously.

import os
import numpy as np

# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Load experiment data
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
working_dir = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "working")
file_path = os.path.join(working_dir, "experiment_data.npy")
experiment_data = np.load(file_path, allow_pickle=True).item()


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Helper functions
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
def best_loss(loss_list):
    """Return the minimum loss from a list of losses."""
    return float(np.min(loss_list)) if loss_list else None


def best_mcc(mcc_list):
    """Return the maximum MCC from a list of MCC scores."""
    return float(np.max(mcc_list)) if mcc_list else None


# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Print metrics for every dataset
# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
for dataset_name, data in experiment_data.items():
    print(f"{dataset_name}:")

    # Losses
    train_loss_best = best_loss(data["losses"].get("train", []))
    val_loss_best = best_loss(data["losses"].get("val", []))

    # MCC metrics
    train_mcc_best = best_mcc(data["metrics"].get("train_MCC", []))
    val_mcc_best = best_mcc(data["metrics"].get("val_MCC", []))
    test_mcc_final = data["metrics"].get("test_MCC", None)

    # Print with explicit labels
    if train_loss_best is not None:
        print(f"  training loss (minimum): {train_loss_best:.4f}")
    if val_loss_best is not None:
        print(f"  validation loss (minimum): {val_loss_best:.4f}")
    if train_mcc_best is not None:
        print(
            f"  training Matthews correlation coefficient (maximum): {train_mcc_best:.4f}"
        )
    if val_mcc_best is not None:
        print(
            f"  validation Matthews correlation coefficient (maximum): {val_mcc_best:.4f}"
        )
    if test_mcc_final is not None:
        print(f"  test Matthews correlation coefficient (final): {test_mcc_final:.4f}")
